title.narrative: Protection monitoring and life-saving assistance for IDPs, returnees and other vulnerable people

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide IDPs, host communities and other persons of concern (returned Burundian refugees, urban refugees) with protection and humanitarian assistance, for a safer protection environment. UNHCR will use CERF funds to 1) identify and manage victims of human rights violations and abuse and 2) distribute core relief items (NFIs, shelter, birth/deceased kits), among other activities. 37,000 IDPs, 26,000 people in host communities and 9,000 other affected people in the Makamba, Rumonge, Bujumbura Rural, Bujumbura Mairie, Cibitoke and Kirundo provinces will benefit from this support for nine months.
